str2: A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Happy, blessed, to be envied. A prolonged form of the poetical makar; supremely blest; by extension, fortunate, well off.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
